intro: Senghasia auriculata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters in its natural habitat. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Senghasia auriculata thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
